title: Swinging Arm - Assembly

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Caution - General - When using a press
Crushing injuries to the hand, arms or unprotected parts of the body is possible when using a press.
Objects such as bearings may break-up or shatter when using a press causing damage and injury.
Always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in minor to moderate injury.
Make sure that the bearing bore is clean and free of debris before installing new bearings.
A thin smear of multi-purpose NLGI 2 specification grease should be added to the bearings, spacer tubes and seals.
When Inserting bearings always press against the marked or shielded side and always fit new bearing seals.
Grease the new needle roller bearings with grease to NLGI 2 standard.
Press a new right hand inner seal into the swinging arm.
Press a new needle roller bearing into the right hand side of the swinging arm.
Press a new left hand inner seal into the swinging arm.
Press a new needle roller bearing into the left hand side of the swinging arm.
Insert the right hand spacer tube through the needle roller bearing.
Press a new right hand outer seal into the swinging arm.
Insert the left hand spacer tube through the needle roller bearing.
Press a new left hand outer seal into the swinging arm.
